page.title: 15Visitors in Silverdale
page.content: This is part of a designated Area Of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It attracts visitors who appreciate the peaceful and natural beauty of its outlook. Across the bay can be seen Grange-Over-Sands and further north the Lakeland hills. There are various footpaths which can be used to give a pleasant walk of any desired distance. The RSPB own the coastline and are extending their interest by building a hide on the marsh which attracts many birdwatchers. The cliffs under Jack Scout and by the Cow's Mouth are 10 to 15 metres high and are used by rock climbers. A deep channel off Jenny Brown's Point is used in the summer for swimming.
